properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 7 at 4:29AM EST until February 7 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Morristown TN
properties.description:
...Accumulating snowfall expected across the northern Plateau and
higher elevations of East Tennessee and southwest Virginia early
this morning through mid afternoon...

Cold air will continue to spill into the region this morning
behind a cold front and rain will change to snow across the
Plateau, and higher elevations of east Tennessee and southwest
Virginia. As an upper level trough swings through the area,
widespread precipitation this morning will become more isolated
by the afternoon hours as the trough lifts out of the area.

Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are expected with locally
higher amounts up to 5 inches possible across the highest
elevations of the Smoky Mountains.

* WHAT...Rain mixed with and changing to snow early this morning. Total
snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, mainly over Grassy and
elevated surfaces.

* WHERE...Northern Plateau and Lee County, Virginia.

* WHEN...From 1 AM EST /midnight CST/ to 1 PM EST /noon CST/
Friday. Greatest snow accumulations will occur between
Midnight and Daybreak.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions across secondary
roadways. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning
commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST /NOON CST/ THIS AFTERNOON
